data.title: Tesla introduces new software update that comes with Netflix and 'Car-aoke'
data.text: Some Tesla owners will soon have more to do in their cars than simply driving them. Karaoke, anyone?

data.title: Dan Ives on Tesla: This continues to be a challenged company
data.text: Wedbush Securities Managing Director Dan Ives discusses the challenges Tesla faces despite Elon Musk telling employees has a shot of delivering 100,000 cars.

data.title: Can Elon Musk hit record delivery numbers
data.text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports ahead of Tesla's earnings--can Elon Musk Deliver.

data.title: Tesla shares jump on leaked deliveries email, entertainment software update
data.text: Tesla Inc  shares closed up 6% on Thursday on a report that Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk saw "a shot" at delivering 100,000 cars this quarter and the company said it will roll out a software update for watching movies and playing games in cars.

data.title: Why Tesla, Mobile Mini, and WillScot Jumped Today
data.text: Two of these stocks could be interested in combining.

data.title: Why Tesla Stock Jumped Thursday
data.text: A number of positive headlines are affecting Tesla stock today.

data.title: Tesla Shares Climb After Musk Tells Staff 100,000 Deliveries Possible
data.text: Tesla Inc. shares climbed the most since July after Elon Musk said in an email to employees that the carmaker has a chance to top the vehicle-delivery record it set in the second quarter. Bloomberg's Craig Trudell has more on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

data.title: 'Tesla Theater' to come with company's 'biggest software update ever'
data.text: Tesla Inc. TSLA, +6.06% said Thursday it is ready to roll its latest over-the-air software update, calling it its "biggest" ever and one that includes Tesla Theater.

data.title: Tesla Stock Jumps As Leaked E-Mail Suggests Record Deliveries
data.text:
Tesla stock took flight on a report it could be positioned to set a record on deliveries of its all-electric vehicles in the third quarter, according to a leaked email by Elon Musk.
The post Tesla Stock Jumps As Leaked E-Mail Suggests Record Deliveries appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Tesla V10.0 car software update adds Smart Summon, Netflix/YouTube, Spotify, karaoke and more
data.text: Tesla is rolling out a new software update that adds a slew of new features to its cars. These include the new ‘Smart Summon’ feature which will allow cars equipped with the optional $5,000 full-self driving package to automatically drive themselves from a parking spot to collect you in a parking spot.

data.title: Part 8: Autopilot - Musk’s Wishful Thinking or Tesla's Greatest Advantage?
data.text: When you buy a Model 3 today, it comes with the Autopilot feature; you can pay $6,000 for Full Self-Driving package.

data.title: Part 9: Elon Musk’s Notorious Promise - Why Tesla's Future Success Might Not Be in His Hands
data.text: Elon Musk is unlike any leader we’ve ever seen. For most people, building PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) would have been an incredible achievement.

data.title: Tesla jumps on report Musk aims to deliver record 100,000 cars this quarter
data.text: Shares of Tesla jumped nearly 5% after Electrek, an electric vehicle news website, reported the internal email from Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

data.title: A look at auto insurance registration data in China may show Tesla sales surging
data.text: An analyst believes data on automotive insurance registrations reveals that Tesla has strong demand in the key Chinese market.

data.title: Forget Ford and GM -- Tesla Has a Startup in the Electric Truck Market to Worry About
data.text: Tesla is facing competition from startup Rivian in bringing an electric truck to market.

data.title: Tesla Fails Second Attempt To Mount New Resistance
data.text: Tesla stock has reversed for the second time in two months at heavy resistance generated by April's high-volume breakdown.
